text.p: Here are the highlights from Swiss newspapers on Monday:

- Swiss Minister Flavio Cotti, back from his three-day visit to the U.S., said he was satisfied with the way discussions went. But he said it would take months or years of hard work to improve Switzerland's image.
- It should be possible to stop using atomic energy in Switzerland by the year 2030, according to a study by the Swiss Electrical Works Association (VSE).
- Technology group Sulzer posted an 11 percent profit decline in 1996 to 82 million Swiss francs.
- Voters in the canton of Fribourg rejected a people's initiative that would have given foreigners in the canton the right to vote.
- Some 650,000 people visited the Geneva Automobile Salon, which came to an end yesterday.
